Package userinterface

Class AbstractFrame

java.lang.Object
userinterface.AbstractFrame
Direct Known Subclasses:
BookmarksBar, ContentFrame, DocumentCell, GenericDialogScreen, Pane
public abstract class AbstractFrame
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class to denote the concept of a graphical window within which content can be displayed.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    boolean hasFocus
    A boolean variable to denote whether this AbstractFrame has focus right now.

      Parameters:

    • handleMouse

      public abstract void handleMouse​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount, int button, int modifiersEx)
      Handle mouseEvents. Determine if this AbstractFrame was pressed and do the right actions.
      Parameters:
      id - : The type of mouse activity
      x - : The x coordinate of the mouse activity
      y - : The y coordinate of the mouse activity
      clickCount - : The number of clicks
      button - : The mouse button that was clicked
      modifiersEx - : The control keys that were held on the click

    • handleKey

      public abstract void handleKey​(int id, int keyCode, char keyChar, int modifiersEx)
      Handle key presses. This method does the right action when a key is pressed.
      Parameters:
      id - : The KeyEvent (Associated with type of KeyEvent)
      keyCode - : The KeyEvent code (Determines the involved key)
      keyChar - : The character representation of the involved key
      modifiersEx - : Specifies other keys that were involved in the event

    • handleResize

      public abstract void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      This method handles resizes. It makes sure the AbstractFrame is adjusted in width when the window shrinks or grows. It does not change its height (e.g. look at Firefox).

      N.B.: without this method, BookmakrBar would be rendered with the given absolute width, and thus one would need to guess the correct initial size of the window. Using this method, widths are automatically adjusted: both at initialization and at runtime.

      Parameters:
      newWindowHeight - : parameter containing the new window-height of this AbstractFrame.
      newWindowWidth - : parameter containing the new window-width of this AbstractFrame.

    • toggleFocus

      public void toggleFocus​(boolean newState)
      Toggle whether this AbstractFrame has focus right now.
      Parameters:
      newState - : The new boolean value to denote whether this AbstractFrame has focus right now.

    • outOfVerticalBounds

      public boolean outOfVerticalBounds()
      Determines whether this AbstractFrame falls outside the vertical bounds of this AbstractFrame's reference.

      Returns:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
